# Overview
In this project, I scraped data from the web using **BeautifulSoup**, processed it with **Pandas**, and created interactive visualizations with **Plotly**.

# Skills Demonstrated
- Web Scraping
- Data Cleaning
- Interactive Visualization

# Key Code Example

```{python}
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import pandas as pd

# Simulated web scraping
html_content = """
<table>
<tr><th>Country</th><th>Population</th></tr>
<tr><td>USA</td><td>331 million</td></tr>
<tr><td>Canada</td><td>38 million</td></tr>
<tr><td>Mexico</td><td>128 million</td></tr>
</table>
"""

# Parse the HTML
soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, "html.parser")
rows = soup.find_all("tr")

# Extract data
data = []
for row in rows[1:]:  # Skip header
    cols = row.find_all("td")
    country = cols[0].text
    population = cols[1].text
    data.append({"Country": country, "Population": population})

# Create DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)
df
```

# üåç Visualization Example

```{python}
import plotly.express as px

# Simple bar plot
fig = px.bar(df, x="Country", y="Population", title="Population by Country")
fig.show()
```
